title: Ayn Rand: The Russian Radical  2nd ed (2013) epub
description:
Author of The Fountainhead and Atlas Shrugged, Ayn Rand (1905Ã¢â‚¬â€œ1982) is one of the most widely read philosophers of the twentieth century. Yet, despite the sale of over thirty million copies of her works, there have been few serious scholarly examinations of her thought. Ayn Rand: The Russian Radical provides a comprehensive analysis of the intellectual roots and philosophy of this controversial thinker.

 It has been nearly twenty years since the original publication of Chris SciabarraÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Ayn Rand: The Russian Radical. Those years have witnessed an explosive increase in Rand sightings across the social landscape: in books on philosophy, politics, and culture; in film and literature; and in contemporary American politics, from the rise of the Tea Party to recent presidential campaigns. During this time Sciabarra continued to work toward the reclamation of the dialectical method in the service of a radical libertarian politics, culminating in his book Total Freedom: Toward a Dialectical Libertarianism (Penn State, 2000).

 This new edition of Ayn Rand adds two chapters that provide in-depth analysis of the most complete transcripts to date documenting RandÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s education at Petrograd State University. It includes a new preface that places the book in the context of SciabarraÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s own research and the recent expansion of interest in RandÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s beliefs. And finally, this edition adds a postscript that answers a recent critic of SciabarraÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s historical work on Rand. Shoshana Milgram, RandÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s biographer, has tried to cast doubt on RandÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s own recollections of having studied with the famous Russian philosopher N. O. Lossky. Sciabarra shows that MilgramÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s analysis fails to cast doubt on RandÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s recollectionsÃ¢â‚¬â€or on SciabarraÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s historical thesis.
